headline: Tesla Investors Pivot to Dreams of AI Future as EV Sales to Slow
summary: Chief among them is its stunning lack of earnings growth while its stock price continues to soar.  The Elon Musk-led electric vehicle-maker is expected to post a 25% drop in third-quarter profits from a year ago when it reports earnings Wednesday afternoon, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.  The decline is nothing new, as Tesla’s results have been in retreat for multiple years.

headline: Meta cutting 600 AI jobs even as it continues to hire more for its superintelligence lab
summary: Meta Platforms is cutting roughly 600 artificial intelligence jobs even as it continues to hire more workers for its superintelligence lab, the company confirmed on Wednesday.  Axios first reported the cuts, which will affect Meta’s Fundamental AI Research, or FAIR unit, as well as product-related AI and AI infrastructure units.  Citing a memo sent to workers by chief AI officer Alexandr Wang, Axios said the company is encouraging employees affected to apply for other jobs at Meta, with most expected to find other roles.

raw.headline: Meta cutting 600 AI jobs even as it continues to hire more for its superintelligence lab
raw.summary: Meta Platforms is cutting roughly 600 artificial intelligence jobs even as it continues to hire more workers for its superintelligence lab, the company confirmed on Wednesday.  Axios first reported the cuts, which will affect Meta’s Fundamental AI Research, or FAIR unit, as well as product-related AI and AI infrastructure units.  Citing a memo sent to workers by chief AI officer Alexandr Wang, Axios said the company is encouraging employees affected to apply for other jobs at Meta, with most expected to find other roles.

headline: Meta Cuts 600 Jobs in AI Division
summary: Meta Platforms  is cutting about 600 jobs in its AI division, according to an internal memo that was viewed by The Wall Street Journal and a person familiar with the matter.  The job cuts will affect the company’s teams focused on artificial-intelligence products, infrastructure and long-term AI research, but won’t touch TBD Lab, the new team that houses most of Meta Chief Executive  Mark Zuckerberg’s  multimillion-dollar hires, the memo said.

raw.headline: Meta Cuts 600 Jobs in AI Division
raw.summary: Meta Platforms  is cutting about 600 jobs in its AI division, according to an internal memo that was viewed by The Wall Street Journal and a person familiar with the matter.  The job cuts will affect the company’s teams focused on artificial-intelligence products, infrastructure and long-term AI research, but won’t touch TBD Lab, the new team that houses most of Meta Chief Executive  Mark Zuckerberg’s  multimillion-dollar hires, the memo said.

headline: GM to bring Google's Gemini AI to cars, Meta cutting 600 jobs

Meta (META) announced 600 job cuts in its artificial intelligence (AI) unit. General Motors (GM) unveiled plans to bring driver assist technology and Google's (GOOG, GOOGL) Gemini AI to its cars. Tesla (TSLA) is kicking off "Magnificent Seven" earnings after Wednesday's closing bell. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Warner Bros. Had Bids From Paramount, Report Says. It Rejected All 3.
summary: Paramount Skydance  latest offer to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery has been rejected, according to a report.  Last month, there were multiple reports that Paramount Skydance was preparing a takeover bid for Warner Bros.  On Wednesday, CNBC reported that Warner Bros. had rejected a third takeover offer from Paramount.

headline: Focus on AI and growth at a reasonable price, strategist says
summary: Citi analysts recommended that investors look at the growing tech landscape through the lens of "Growth at a Reasonable Price," or GARP, as Wall Street continues to chatter on the likelihood of an AI bubble forming.  Citi Head of US equity strategy Scott Chronert comes on Market Catalysts to talk about how his team is analyzing AI growth. headline: Meta Raised $27 Billion for an AI Data Center. Who’s Backing the Deal.
summary: Meta Platforms  and its partner raised $27 billion in private debt to fund the construction of its Hyperion data center in Louisiana.  Bond manager  Pimco  was the biggest buyer, accounting for around $18 billion, while asset manager  BlackRock  bought more than $3 billion of bonds, The Wall Street Journal reported late Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.  The Hyperion project is 80%-owned by private-credit manager  Blue Owl Capital  while Meta, Facebook’s parent, owns the remaining 20% stake.

raw.headline: Meta Raised $27 Billion for an AI Data Center. Who’s Backing the Deal.

The Hyperion project is 80%-owned by private-credit manager  Blue Owl Capital  while Meta, Facebook’s parent, owns the remaining 20% stake.
